title: Good for a leisurely lunch
text:
We went for lunch on a weekend. There was parking available. The restaurant is on the 4th floor. The place was less than half filled. We decided to go for the buffet lunch on table option.
The menu is available below in the pictures. The spread is good, for both veg and non-veg options. There’s the soup, three starters, three curries in the main, all roti/ naan options, biryanis, noodles, etc and lastly three desserts.
The food was tasty in general. The quantity is good and you might just stick to the first serving unless you really like a particular dish. Amongst starters the fish was good. The only dish I was disappointed with was the mutton rogan josh. It was bad. If I had go for the a la carte then I wouldn’t risk the mutton dishes.
The people are good but keep in mind that service is slow, hence the leisurely lunch!

title: Intricate carvings and architecture!!
text:
The Sun temple is a must visit if you’re in Bhubaneswar/ Puri / Chilika zone.
It’s a monument and not a functioning temple.
There were three structures out of which the largest has almost completely broken down so the middle one can be seen, and it is quite a huge structure at 100 feet. It was higher than that at some point of time when it was built in the 13th century.
The entry ticket is Rs 40 and it takes about an hour if you want to do a quick round of the ruins. It is advisable to hire a guide for about Rs 250 to see the main points and understand the intricate carvings, architecture and history.
There’s a Yatri Nivas a couple hundred meters from the site, where you can park your car, refresh and walk to the temple. That’s almost where all vehicles need to stop and you need to proceed by walk.
TIP: The Yatri Nivas can help give a pass for vehicles if you have someone who cannot walk.
It’s sad to see the stone carvings slowly eroding. I had visited the place one in early 90s and the carvings were clearer then.

title: Pilgrimage tour
text:
We visited in December. There were enclosures for pilgrims and red carpets all through.
There’s car parking a couple hundred before the temple complex.
The process to go in is quite straight forward but if you want a pundit to accompany you then you can engage one outside the temple while in the queue.
The entrance was quite clean well maintained.

title: Good food, accommodation & ambience!!
text:
We were there for a night while visiting Puri and Konark.
The resort is almost at the end of all hotels/resorts near the beach. Ample parking.
The checkin process was smooth. The reception staff were helpful. They have rooms on the ground and 1st / 2nd floors. Their staff was helpful in taking our luggage to the allotted 2nd floor room. If you have any difficulty in climbing then make a request for a ground floor room in advance.
The room was big with a sofa cum bed big enough for a third guest/kid/adult. The room were very neat clean and well maintained. The bathroom was good, hot water etc. Wifi is available on payment.
The dinner was at their restaurant which serves buffet and alacarte. We went in for the buffet as it was a very impressive spread of largely Indian and a few Chinese/ Italian dishes. The breakfast was also at the same place and the spread was equally good. South /North Indian spread plus live counter for dosa, eggs etc.
The facilities include indoor games, swimming pool, proximity to the beach.
In all was a good experience.

title: Keema-Naan breakfast!!!
text:
You want to enjoy Keema naan for breakfast then Paradise at Paradise, Secunderabad is the place to go!!!
One naan and a plate of keema is just the right quantity. Add a dash of lemon to make it tangy. Follow it with a cup of hot Irani chai.
Keema naan in Paradise is a speciality only in Secunderabad the original Paradise. And not in the other joints across the city. This is available only early mornings from around 7 to 9 am. Sometime later too if you’re lucky!

title: Loved the pasta al forno!!
text:
This place is at the end of the lane adjacent Neerus near Madhapur. There’s valet service. We went for dinner on a weekday. We didn’t make a reservation and didn’t seem like it was required. The place was half full. The ambience was good. Minimalistic style. High ceiling with lamps. Looked nice and warm on a December evening.
We were a family and friends group of 6. Ordered a couple of pizzas, pastas and lasagne.
The pizzas are 10” - 8 slice ones. We Iiked the chicken pizza - Straniera, and the vegetarian- pizza margherita. Thin crust, with good amount of cheese and cottage cheese cubes. Tasted good!
The lasagne tasted good. The portion was small.
The pasta Al forno was my favorite! Spaghetti in pink mushroom sauce. Added a bit of crushed black pepper and it was exactly the way I like it!
The service was good. The overall experience was good!!!

title: Sizzling joint for sizzlers!
text:
At 9 pm on a weekday the place was reasonably full. Families, couples, friends seemed to be enjoying the sizzlers.
We ordered a chilli paneer sizzler and a non-veg mixed grill sizzler. It took a few minutes browsing through the variety to decide.
The ambience is good, warm. The service is good, warm and reasonably fast.
Both the sizzlers were very good, meeting expectations! You can opt for noodles or rice. The veg paneer sizzler was the Chinese style. The mixed grill comes with a fried egg. No frills.
The kitchen, rest rooms and parking seem common for three joints adjacent each other. The path to the rest rooms can be improved. Reminds me of dhabas.
In all a good experience! Will go back to try the other options!

title: Hotel in the center of sightseeing attractions in Athens
text:
The hotel staff was kind enough to guide us with the places to visit using a local map. The places are almost in a circular route - all around this hotel. Starting with the acropolis to the museum, stadium, parliament etc.
The local market area, flea market is also quite close - 5 min walk. It’s close to the Monastiraki metro station.
The hotel itself is very neat and professionally managed. The staff are courteous. The rooms are spacious, well designed and clean. The one we were in had a small balcony good enough to get a sunset view and a view of the acropolis top.
The roof top bar and restaurant is a great place to spend the evening during sunset. Get some good food, drinks and sunset photographs.
The wifi is excellent.

title: Colorful Sunday market along the canal!!
text:
Navigli Sunday market - On the last Sunday of each month the path/road along the canal in Milan - Naviglio Grande, is transformed into a long and beautiful market. There are several stalls/shops selling flowers, vegetables, cheese, handicrafts, toys and many other things Along the canal stretch for a kilometer or more.
The stuff you can see is sometimes very unique and beautiful. And each seller is so passionately involved in selling explaining their goods.
I liked the experience. It’s a good time to spend for a couple hours on a last Sunday morning each month.

title: Warm experience!!
text:
Villa Anemoessa is beautiful hotel or like a resort. Nice swimming pool, beautiful rooms, sea view, great breakfast spread. Very well located. Just 15 min walking distance from the most popular Santorini sunset point as well as the market area that you can walk through and spend your evenings.
Irine, at the reception desk is a very warm person and very helpful. She guided us on places to visit, transportation and other local guidance.
Strongly recommend staying here!!

title: Revisiting history!!
text:
Not to be missed if you’re as far as in Athens!
The entrance fee to the acropolis is Eur20 each. It takes about 30 min to climb up. On the way you get to see the open auditorium area - which is a very huge area. Then you proceed to the Parthenon. Some of the area is under restoration, but that doesn’t effect must aesthetically.
You can get pictures on the way and certainly in the top.

title: Good portions of Indian food!!
text:
We were going around the market area and chances upon the Mirch Indian restaurant.
They have a lot of space on the ground and first floor for seating.
Food is prepared in Indian style and served efficiently. You pay first and be seated while the food is prepared and served.
We had chicken curry, Mash daal, naan, vegetable rice at this place on two occasions.
The chicken curry and urad daal were excellent. Not spicy. But you can get onions and mirchi complementary. The portions are big. One curry and naan or rice is good for two people. Naan comes in four pieces.
Vegetable rice is the Indian pulao version. Not vegetable pulao.
They also have full bar. You can get Cobra beer, Jaipur beer, and many others.
The service is fast.

title: Great hospitality!
text:
Beautiful hotel. You can get a sea facing room with a beautiful view of the sea. The hotel is about 10 min from the airport - at about Eur15 by cab.
Sofia, at the reception desk was very helpful and guided us on what and how of Mykonos.
Rooms are very good, clean, white. Breakfast is a good spread.
The car and bike hiring location is a 2 min walk from the hotel. The best way to go around Mykonos I think is a scooter.

title: In Lido next to Burano and Murano
text:
The hotel is 5 min walking distance from the Lido water bus stop. The check in desk entry is via a narrow corridor but that doesn’t matter when you’re going to use it just a couple times in a day.
The room is granite floored and because the weather was around 14 deg C when we were staying we needed a heater which the hotel staff provided.
The room as such is spacious. The TV is covered with a mirror. The wifi was good.
The staff was very helpful in guiding us around the islands, the boats to take and places to visit. Ms Flor was helpful.
Their restaurant is open to all on the ground floor with a garden and a bar. The food was good.

title: Close proximity to sightseeing spots!
text:
This hotel is about 10-15 min walk from the sightseeing spots like the Milan cathedral, galleria, Porta Ticinese; and similar distance to the Cadirna station - that you can use to arrive / depart for the Milan Malpensa airport.
The hotel is on the main road yet no disturbance in the hotel rooms. You might hear/sense the teams going past though.
The lifts/elevators are 5-6 steps below the checkin desk, but the hotel serves you to get your luggage across, so it’s not a concern.
Breakfast is good. There’s a bar. Staff is courteous. Room was very neat and clean and reasonably spacious. Bathroom was quite small - but that is most of them are nowadays.

title: The magnificent Cathedral of Milan
text:
The magnificent cathedral, that can house 40,000 people, took five centuries to complete. It’s made of large sculpted marble columns. The glass painting on several walls connecting the columns are beautiful.
The entrance to the cathedral is Eur3. Additional 14 euros for the terrace, to get panoramic views of Milan. The fast track tickets are Eur25.
Galleria Vittorio Emanuele - galleria is the next to the cathedral. You could visit both these places together. There’s also a Leonardo d Vinci museum in the galleria - entrance fee Eur12 (lesser if visiting in groups).

title: Beautiful but at peak times can be crowded
text:
The fountain is very famous and is in lanes and it appears out of nowhere.
It is beautiful but if you visit it at a time when there are a lot of people then you can barely get a good picture and just sit there for a few minutes amongst the crowd.
There are a few thousand euros collected each day that people throw as coins in the fountain- that go to charitable activities.

title: Beautiful place to visit!
text:
The Colosseum is a beautiful monument with beyond intricate architecture!!
For a detailed tour one requires more than a day, to absorb the beauty from the outside and also understand the history by taking a tour inside.
The views also vary depending on the time of the day. You can get splendid pictures at sunrise from one end and on sunset from the other end. I personally found the sunset side more interesting for photography.
There’s a hillock near the Colosseum which is a good vantage point.

title: Compact and right in the touristy zone
text:
The hotel is very conveniently located for a walk to the Colloseum and a few other sightseeing spots in that zone of Rome.
If you’re a couple then the room is quite compact with just enough space for you to move about. The room is very neat and is cleaned and replenished everyday.
I would suggest there be a hot water kettle for some morning tea/coffee, and also a table.
There’s a lift so there’s nothing to worry about carrying your luggage to your room.
There’s a small bar and a restaurant on the ground floor. The breakfast is served from 7-10 am. The breakfast is good but the place can get crowded if you come in late.
The staff are quite courteous.
In all a good comfortable stay!

title: Taking the tradition ahead
text:
The place is neat and clean. The food has the traditional style of the Taj Mahal hotel. Service is good - most of the times. Rava dosa arrived unexpectedly fast, but thali took longer than expected!
Personally I think the taste and options are better at the Abids main hotel. If you’re in Hyderabad Abids Taj Mahal is the place to go to.

title: Good place for a group dinner
text:
Enjoyed the venue, which was the top floor with an AC section and an open to sky area. Enjoyed the service, beer, starters and food.
Liked the Lime beer and the Wheat beer amongst the other options.
Innovative decor, dishes, drinks!
Overall a good experience!!

title: ITC’s luxury 24 hour restaurant
text:
We went there for a family buffet lunch on a Saturday, as it is close to our residence.
It’s a safe bet from quality, service and ambience standpoint.
It’s in the lower lobby. There’s a lift in case you have a senior citizen or anyone who needs to take that option.
The place is usually not busy, so you can have a peaceful meal and have a normal volume conversation.
The spread is huge - 5 star variety on starters, chats, salads, mains and desserts. Multiple cuisines to choose from. I enjoyed the Indian dishes, with addition of a few Chinese and Continental dishes. I’m it describing the options as you’re sure to enjoy something or the other from the wide choice. Posting a few pictures - if that helps!
There’s also a full bar to go along.
The swimming pool is just outside the restaurant so you can enjoy basking in the sun for sometime!
All in all - always a good experience!!

title: The set menu feast!
text:
Ottimo is an Italian restaurant in the ITC Kohenur opposite Inorbit mall in Hyderabad.
The restaurant is on the top floor, and that provides you with a wonderful view of the hitec city area.
We got an exclusive room that was perfect for us. We chose to go with one of the set menu options.
I liked the cheese options (yellow and gray) and the bread. The had a starter of ham, mushroom risotto (which was very tasty - recommended) followed by the rabbit ravioli, and then the main course of lamb. Had tiramisu for dessert. The food was certainly very filling and very appetizing the way it was presented and served.
The overall experience was wonderful. The service was excellent. I’d definitely want to return to try the other options.

title: Don’t miss the Steamed dosa and Babai idli
text:
We go to Chutneys regularly and can never miss the steamed dosa and the Babai Idly.
The Babai idli is becoming a bit regular but the steamed dosa is still unique and well prepared.
As such, the lunch thaali is also very good and strongly recommended.

title: Open kitchen with a combination of traditional and modern dishes
text:
It is in the new ITC Kohenoor hotel in Madhapur. They offer a wide variety of wonderful Chinese cuisine traditional and modern. Their open kitchen is a great experience- to watch the Chef prepare many complex dishes in a simple looking style with ease! It was a treat to watch the Hand-pulled Noodles.
They also have several sections to accommodate small and big groups of customers.
The ambience is soothing, nice and bright with natural sunlight during the day. The color theme is largely red (not surprising).
The food is wonderful and the service is great! A wide spread of dIm-sums. I liked the Sake edamame dimsums. Their Prawn Crispy Cheung Fun Roll was also tasty.
In all a good Chinese experience!

title: Good dimsums!!!
text:
We went for the current dim sum festival for lunch and enjoyed a wide variety of dim sums - both vegetarian and non-vegetarian.
The food is wonderful, ambience is great and service is slow paced but good. (I wouldn’t go there in a working day or when in a hurry!)
The set menu included a thupka (soup) (various options available), a series of dim-sums, along with a few other unique and good starters, followed by rice/ noodle options with sauces/gravies/side dishes and wrapped up with a dessert (cake and ice cream).
Good value for money.

title: You’d go there if you’re staying there
text:
It’s a restaurant within the Aditya Hometel hotel. They probably are happy with their captive in-house guests. May be that was a reason for being week in being customer oriented.
Ambience is good, just a few guests on a Sunday afternoon.
Starters are just two (veg; no non-veg starters). Mains: noodles, couple veg dishes, pulav, Chicken Biryani and Chicken curry. Very basic menus.
Desserts were good with 4 good varieties plus fruits and ice cream (you need to ask!).
Overall an average experience. You’d go there only if you’re staying there.

title: North Indian delight!!
text:
Valet parking was convenient. We didn’t go with a reservation on a Saturday night and we were not disappointed.
Interiors remind you of the urban dhaba generalisation! Theka (bar), Jants & Ladis (restrooms), jail set up (in a dhaba!), famous dialogues of our Bollywood villains, villains painted on the walls, more finer quotes and designs on the tables!!! A good conversation starter for sure!!!
Goli ka soda takes you back the memory lane.
We enjoyed the tiffin ke dabbe mein served mutton curry and kulcha (Tiffin ka meat & kulcha). Not too spicy, just right. Well cooked, nice chunks. Loved it!
Veg: Dhaba chilli Paneer - was prepared a bit differently; was not spicy, had green chilies that could be removed (thankfully, as we didn’t want the sweet tasting paneer dishes).
The kulchas were good too. Sirke ki pyaz and green chatni were on the table. Soft drinks were pleasantly served with ice cubes and a slice of lemon.
Drain all the stuff with sodas, soft drinks, liquor.
Service was good and fast. For some reason the guy clearing the table at the end was in a hurry to get done with his job!
Closed our dinner with a hajmola type candy.
Will go back to try other mutton dishes!

title: Nice spread, ambience and service!!
text:
Madan did a great job making us feel comfortable and getting all that we needed.
It was a family dinner. The buffet spread was good. About 4 starters each veg and non-veg. Salads including sushi (veg/non-veg options).
Live snacks / starters counter. Mains had mutton and veg Biryani. Mutton curry and chicken curry were great! Makhni daal paneer etc.
A very big dessert spread!!
1500+ tax. Liquor, other beverages are also served.
Alacarte also available.
Advance reservation will avoid embarrassment.

title: Gallery visit - a must
text:
The Victoria Memorial structure is grand and beautiful. The gardens and the water bodies around make it even more picturesque.
You can get beautiful pictures from four sides of the structure.
The museum: There’s a free guided tour at 11am, 1 pm and 3 pm for 30 min, inside the monument. This is a must - not to be missed. These are conducted by volunteers who are doing their masters in history and have a very good understanding of the different artifacts on display, the historical background and knowledge. Without the tour it would seem like going through an exhibition of paintings, statues and artifacts.
The marble building has Indian marble that is similar to ones used to build the Taj Mahal. Sent to Italy for statues to be sculpted and brought back. It was built between 1906 and 1921, dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria (1819–1901).

title: Two colours combining to one!
text:
This place - Sangam Valley is a 48 kilometre drive from Leh and is the confluence of the rivers Indus and Zanskar.
Just the view of this Valley from the road above itself is beautiful. You can also go down and do some river rafting, click beautiful pictures.
The colours of the two rivers can be distinctly seen at the confluence. It is an amazing place to sit, relax, and enjoy.
This is also the worlds highest rafting point.
As a tourist you can spend about an hour at this spot, unless you go in for rafting!
place: Confluence of the Indus and Zanskar Rivers

title: Tribute to our martyrs safeguarding our country
text:
This is a museum by the Indian Army in memory of the brave Indian soldiers who laid down their lives defending the motherland in the Indo-Pak wars. Located about 4km from the city of Leh it stands as a reminder of the great sacrifices made by our soldiers to ensure the safety and security of our country.
There’s also a display of the arms, ammunition, apparel, history, geography of Ladakh.
A must visit place for every Indian to be aware of the sacrifices made by our defence personnel to safeguard our country.
There’s a nominal entree fee. An Army soldier will provide a proper tour and explain everything in a professional manner. There’s also a souvenir shop. This place will require about 45 min to an hour for a stop.

title: Largest monastery in central Ladakh
text:
Thiksay Monastery is a Tibetan-style monastery affiliated with the Gelug sect of Tibetan Buddhism. Located on top of a hill in Thiksey approximately 19 kilometres east of Leh in Ladakh, is noted for its resemblance to the Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet.
It is located on the Manali highway. You can see it while going to do other sights on that road like the Shey palace, Hemis monastery, Rancho school etc.
One of the highlights of the monastery is the Maitreya Temple installed to commemorate the visit of the 14th Dalai Lama to this monastery in 1970 It contains a 49 ft high statue of Maitreya, the largest such statue in Ladakh, covering two stories of the building. From the entrance of the monastery at the hilltop, you get a great view of Leh.
Opposite the monastery is a beautiful hotel and restaurant - Chamba for a good break.

title: Picturesque Pangong!
text:
3Idiots popularised this beautiful and picturesque lake!!!
We travelled from Nubra Hunder. It was a 4-5 hours drive, one side. But worth the time when you reach this spot.
On the way too you can admire the natural beauty and click pictures!
At the lake, you can admire the beautiful colours of the lake that change every few minutes.
You can also click pictures with costumes of 3 Idiots and Jab tak hai jaan.
There are tents and other facilities to stay nearby, but we returned to Leh from there. Another 4-5 hours drive. But a beautiful one.

title: Perfect location and comfortable!!
text:
We had made the reservation via Booking.com
Our flight got cancelled and without any hesitation they changed the booking at no extra cost and no discussion! That was good!
Lingzi is right in the market. So a perfect location. We could just step out each evening into the market.
The room is comfortable. No odour. Bed is good. Clean linen. Hot water available 24 hours.
The place was near the market and main road but not noisy at all.
Good breakfast served, part of the tariff. Toast, butter, jam, egg options, cornflakes, milk, tea, coffee, fruits. Other items we got were- puri bhaji/ idli/poha.
WiFi was available 24 hours, but access was only in the lobby. This turned out good, as we could just relax once in the room.
We had booked for a day, to check it out, but extended for 5 days.
The front office executive- Rupesh was very cordial and helpful.
The staff as were helpful.

title: Tasty Indian spread!
text:
Sigree offers a wide spread of Indian cuisine in its buffet lunch and dinner - whether it’s the starters or the mains, veg or non-veg.
While there is a la carte option I would recommend the buffet. The buffet is available at lunch and dinner. While they some special offers for the weekend.
If you’re going on a weekend then making a table reservation is good.
The service is good, but because the starters are multiple, you need to be a bit patient.

title: Great decor, service and food!
text:
Liked the jumbo prawns, murgh chandi tikka, pathar gosht, shahi nehari. Warqi paratha was good and unique amongst the breads.
The restaurant has recently started. The service is good. The place seemed a bit cramped. The food was excellent!!
The proximity to Hitec city is good as this is bang opposite the Inorbit mall.

title: A true Jewel of Nizam
text:
This place is a must go for a set menu dinner - The Jewel of Nizam restaurant in Golkonda Resorts, Gandipet.
Have a good appetite as there’s a lot to fulfil your gastronomic desire!
There’s a welcome drink, soup, 3-4 varieties of starters, six non-veg veg curries n dal (including Haleem, mutton, chicken, a dal, and sabzi) with platter of bread, followed by biryani, and finally desserts (anokhi kheer, kheer, khubani). You can have a paan at the end, to officially call it a full meal!!
Similar menu for vegetarians.
Cost about INR 2,500 per head.

title: Good authentic Hyderabadi cuisine
text:
Nice joint, good food, good service.
No reservations on weekends, so be prepared for a wait, if you’re not lucky.
We ordered Haleem, Maraq, patthar ka gosht, mutton biryani- non-veg; and paneer butter masala for veg.
All the items were tasty.
Haleem has a bit of a spicy flavor, which was good. Biryani was not spicy.
The place has some humorous quotes about Chicha, makes it an enjoyable experience.
Good overall experience.

title: Get a glimpse of the UAE history & culture
text:
During our daylong Abu Dhabi tour, we stopped here for about 90 min to have lunch and see the exhibits.
This is like the Delhi Haat or the Shilparamam.
There are small separate museums of the heritage of UAE. The clothes people used to wear, crockery, weapons, etc.
Centre for history of UAE.
You can also see artisans making artifacts and handicrafts.
You can some shopping too.

title: A good Abu Dhabi teaser our with Md Iqbal
text:
Abu Dhabi is a big city and an eight hour tour serves as a teaser for you to come back and spend more days to see the city.
The OceanAir travels did a great job putting a few things to see and experience the city.
As per schedule they picked us from our hotel at 8:50 am. It took about an hour to Abu Dhabi from Dubai.
Mohd Iqbal our guide provided an overview of what to expect and in an entertaining style kept us engaged.
We visited the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque. A very modern and beautiful mosque. Spent about an hour there. Iqbal provided the women with the required attire to enter the mosque.
Viewed the Abu Dhabi Corniche,
passed by the Emirates Palace,
photo-stop in front of the Etihad Towers.
Visited the Heritage Village and had lunch there. Visited the dates Market, saw the various varieties and bought some.
Had an hour photo-stop at the Ferrari world Yas Island. This a place to come back for a day in a trip later.
Will come back!

title: A mini world cultural experience
text:
Global Village Dubai allows you to experience the largest entertainment shows on a regional scale and award-winning theatrical cultural performances, concerts every Friday by International music icons, unique dining experience with restaurants, cafes and street food kiosks, and pavilions for every country.
It is the leading seasonal cultural extravaganza in the region that offers visitors an amazing array of festivals, shopping & entertainment.
We enjoyed all of it, but the best was the Monster Stunt Show.
Spending 5-6 hours with still half of it not covered was quite an experience!

title: Beautiful at sunset time
text:
Chhota Imambara was built by Nawab Muhammad Ali Shah (1837-42).
It is more ornate in design with gilded dome, several turrets, exquisite chandeliers said to be brought from Belgium, gilt-edged mirrors and colourful stuccos which adorn the interiors.
The tombs of Muhammad Ali Shah and other members of his family are inside the Imambara.
There are some very interesting artefacts like a bottle that has a model of the Imambara. An ivory made model. Quran written on a small sheet of paper with rice edge.
There’s a hammam at the entrance. There’s a description of the showers and hot water supply that’s interesting. There are guides available.
At sunset you can get some beautiful pictures.

title: Taste with attitude
text:
The kebabs here are the best!
The lamb kebabs were the best. There are many dishes to try.
If you just want to have the kebabs you could choose the take away option. Four pieces for Rs 84. There’s also an attached restaurant.

title: Gunjing or ‘Metroing’
text:
Hazratgunj or Gunj as popularly known, was a street to spend some time - ‘gunjing’, but now with the metro rail work in progress, it’s very narrow and dusty.
There are some very famous joints, eateries, shopping centres on this road. Moti Mahal is one of those famous savouries shop.
There’s also a multi level parking structure on that road.
The shop signs are written in black & white, for a retro effect.

title: Aptly names restaurant
text:
The one in Lalbagh is a proper restaurant.
There’s usually a waiting time from 10 min upwards during meal times.
The mutton platter is good for you to try four of their famous kebabs. Galowti, shami, Sheek and one in a bowl. The mutton Biryani is excellent.
For vegetarians the paneer masala is excellent. This with their mogulai paratha is wonderful.
Shahi Tukda amongst desserts is popular.
Service is a bit imposing but good.

title: The history of Lucknow
text:
This place tells you the history of Lucknow especially in the last 150 years.
The British Residency has within its walls, the graves of British soldiers who died in the Revolt of 1857. The people of Lucknow tell intriguing stories of the ruins.
The British Residency of Lucknow serves as a government office. The Residency also has a museum that is well-maintained by the authorities. You’ll also find the tombs Sadat Ali Khan, who was the first Nawab of Awadh, Kaisarbagh Palace and an observatory built for Colonel Wilcox, who was a British astronomer.
This place is spread across many acres. Be prepared to walk.

title: A grand entrance!!
text:
A very large and grand entrance!!
Different on both the sides.
An impressive architectural structure constructed in 1784 by Nawab Asaf-ud-daula.
The Rumi Darwaza is an example of the fine architectural style of Awadh. The Rumi Darwaza is also known by the name of Turkish Gateway since it is supposed to be identical in design to a similar gateway in ancient Constantinople.
The road is cobblestone covered in that entire stretch with parking space.
You’ll need to stand on the middle of the road for a good picture.

title: Tasty starters and kebabs!
text:
Nice cosy place in Gomtinagar.
Liked their paya soup. Very well made.
In starters liked their tangdi chicken that was served in a shakora each. Also their mutton and fish kebabs were very good.
The dum ki mutton Biryani was very good too.
Service was personalised and good. Salt was a bit more in the otherwise very tasty kebabs.

title: A beautiful temple In Ayodhya
text:
A beautiful temple, Kanak Bhavan Temple; it is said that Kaikeyee built this temple for Sita as a mark of repentance. Historical information say that Rani Krishnabhanu Kunwari of Orccha constructed this temple in 1891. It is located at a point from where the sunset and sunrise can be seen.
There are three idols of Lord Rama and Sita in this temple.

title: A religious trip
text:
Ayodhya, the janmbhoomi of Lord Rama, is worth visiting, to see various places in Ayodhya. The places we went to are - disputed site, Kanak Bhavan temple, Hanuman gadhi, Sariyu nadi ghat.
Apart from the Darshan which can take long due to security reasons, the other places can be covered in about 2 hours with your own transport. You can buy some besan ke laddoo for prasad at the Hanuman gadhi Mandir.

title: Jai Hanumanji ki!
text:
The Hanuman garhi temple is located on a small hillock. It is a popular religious shrine in Ayodhya. It is approachable by a flight of 76 steps. It is almost always thronged by those with a religious bent of mind. A statue of Mata Anjani with infant Hanuman in her lap is in the inner sanctum of this temple.
You can take some besan ke laddoo and flowers for chadhava.

title: One of the tallest clock towers
text:
The Husainabad Clock Tower is set amidst a picturesque background, near the Picture Gallery.
It is commonly known as Ghantaghar and reflects Victorian and Gothic style designs. Gunmetal is used for building the clock parts. Its gigantic pendulum has a length of 14 feet and the dial of the clock is designed in the shape of a 12-petalled flower and bells around it.
This 221 ft. high Clock Tower was built in 1881 to mark the arrival of Sir George Couper, the first Lieutenant Governor of the United Province of Awadh.

title: A very well maintained and beautiful building and campus
text:
This is one of the most beautiful buildings in India!
The motto of La Martiniere is ‘Labore et constantia’ "By Labour and Constancy".
The La Martiniere College was established in 1845, founded in accordance with the Will of Major General Claude Martin. Born in Lyon, France, in 1735, the Founder died in Lucknow on 13 September, 1800.
Muzaffar Ali, the noted Bollywood film producer, director of Anjuman, Gaman, Umrao jaan and many others studied at this school.
Coming from Lyon, Claude Martin must have acquired an eye for imposing architecture from his childhood days in his beautiful home town. His architectural skills were much in demand at Lucknow and his nearness to Nawab Asaf-ud-daula gave him a unique opportunity to participate in the making of modern Lucknow. Some of the buildings of Lucknow which have Martin's distinctive touch are: Farhad Baksh, Asafi Kothi, Bibiapur, Barowen and of course the Constantia.

title: 5* for the personal connect!
text:
The owner of the resort Kunwar Shobhit Dayal took personal interest from the time we spoke to him first for the resort details. He made sure we understood where Dudhwa is, what facilities are there, which are the places for sightseeing, what are the distances, costs, everything.
He kept all the costs transparent and made bookings/ arrangements for us - the jeep safari at the Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary and the Jeep and elephant safari at the Dudhwa National Park.
The resort has started in November and has good, clean, comfortable rooms, separate and common bonfires (very critical at this time of the year), custom food as per choice. Shobhit took us for a walk around his resort and showed us the sarson jet khet, gehun ke khet, all the plantation, and gave us a brief on the wildlife episodes.
The resort is located very close to the Kishanpur sanctuary. The resort is being well developed; it goes full so book in advance.

title: Authentic Lucknow desserts and savouries
text:
This is a very popular Indian sweets outlet. Enjoyed the various halvas - gajar, badaam, kaali gajar, moong daal etc.
Different gajak - khasta, rolled, chocolate etc.
Cold Kesar milk is very nice. Malai paan and Chandramukhi are also tasty and unique versions of malai.

title: Architectural marvel
text:
The Bara Imambara is called so as there’s also a Chhota Imambara.
This one is a very popular monument to visit in Lucknow. It has a Moghal architecture.
It is popular for its Bhool bhulaiya- maize like stairs that have four options at every turn and only out of the four is correct.
The main structure also has a huge hall one of the largest in Asia unsupported with any pillars inside.
The walls are 15 feet wide.
The bhool bhulaiya is an outcome of cutting away walls on the upper stories to reduce the weight of the structure.
There’s also a beautiful bowli, steppes well inside the complex. It has a unique way for the security in those days to see the reflection of anyone coming in.

title: Go Swami!
text:
As a microbrewery they offer about seven beer options. We tasted them all and went for ‘Go Swami’.
The ambience is good, service is good and food is good. Good options to go with the beer. They did some customisation.
We sat on the first floor, in the area overseeing the main road. It was nice and pleasant (in Dec) and not much noise from the road, surprisingly.
A good place to go. Go Swami!

title: One mythological stop!
text:
A good place to visit to get a glimpse of the various temples and pilgrimage places to visit across the country.
A route has been charted so it keeps you moving.
Photography is not permitted. But that doesn’t stop you from enjoying the experience.
Wear a hat/cap as its all in an open area. I’d avoid the place in summer.

title: Good barbecue, wide spread of food options, snacks and desserts!!
text:
You’re bound to overeat at this place! So be careful. Take a round and decide how you want to enjoy the meal and experience.
The food spread is very good. The good tastes good! Reasonably spicy. BBQ is good and fills you up. Options - Indian, Chinese, Italian. You can order your own style pizza, grill, fried rice contents, cold stone ice cream, cones, beverages unlimited.
Place is busy from 7:30 pm itself.
